VpcSettings.documentation: Information about the VPC settings for the directory.

RadiusSettings.documentation: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server.

RadiusStatus.documentation: Information about the status of the RADIUS server.

OwnerDirectoryDescription.documentation: Describes the directory owner account details that have been shared to the directory consumer account.

RadiusServers.documentation: An array of strings that contains the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) or IP addresses of the RADIUS server endpoints, or the FQDN or IP addresses of your RADIUS server load balancer.

RadiusPort.documentation: The port that your RADIUS server is using for communications. Your self-managed network must allow inbound traffic over this port from the Directory Service servers.

RadiusTimeout.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the RADIUS server to respond.

RadiusRetries.documentation: The maximum number of times that communication with the RADIUS server is retried after the initial attempt.

SharedSecret.documentation: Required for enabling RADIUS on the directory.

AuthenticationProtocol.documentation: The protocol specified for your RADIUS endpoints.

RadiusSettings.documentation: Contains information about a Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) server.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory.

RegionName.documentation: The name of the Region. For example, us-east-1.

RegionType.documentation: Specifies whether the Region is the primary Region or an additional Region.

Status.documentation: The status of the replication process for the specified Region.

DesiredNumberOfDomainControllers.documentation: The desired number of domain controllers in the specified Region for the specified directory.

StatusLastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the Region status was last updated.

LastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the Region description was last updated.

RegionDescription.documentation: The replicated Region information for a directory.

RegionLimitExceededException.documentation: You have reached the limit for maximum number of simultaneous Region replications per directory.

PrimaryRegion.documentation: The Region where the Managed Microsoft AD directory was originally created.

AdditionalRegions.documentation: Lists the Regions where the directory has been replicated, excluding the primary Region.

RegionsInfo.documentation: Provides information about the Regions that are configured for multi-Region replication.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory.

CertificateData.documentation: The certificate PEM string that needs to be registered.

Type.documentation: The function that the registered certificate performs. Valid values include ClientLDAPS or ClientCertAuth. The default value is ClientLDAPS.

ClientCertAuthSettings.documentation: A ClientCertAuthSettings object that contains client certificate authentication settings.

DirectoryId.documentation: The Directory ID that will publish status messages to the Amazon SNS topic.

TopicName.documentation: The Amazon SNS topic name to which the directory will publish status messages. This Amazon SNS topic must be in the same region as the specified Directory ID.

SharedDirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the shared directory in the directory consumer account. This identifier is different for each directory owner account.
Identifier of the shared directory in the directory consumer account.

DirectoryId.documentation: Identifier (ID) of the directory from which you want to remove the IP addresses.

CidrIps.documentation: IP address blocks that you want to remove.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory for which you want to remove Region replication.

ResourceId.documentation: Identifier (ID) of the directory from which to remove the tag.

TagKeys.documentation: The tag key (name) of the tag to be removed.

DirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the Managed Microsoft AD or Simple AD directory in which the user resides.

UserName.documentation: The user name of the user whose password will be reset.

NewPassword.documentation: The new password that will be reset.

SnapshotId.documentation: The identifier of the snapshot to restore from.

RestoreFromSnapshotRequest.documentation: An object representing the inputs for the RestoreFromSnapshot operation.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory to which the schema extension is applied.

SchemaExtensionStatus.documentation: The current status of the schema extension.

StartDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the schema extension started being applied to the directory.

EndDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the schema extension was completed.

ServiceException.documentation: An exception has occurred in Directory Service.

Name.documentation:
The name of the directory setting. For example:

TLS_1_0

Value.documentation: The value of the directory setting for which to retrieve information. For example, for TLS_1_0, the valid values are: Enable and Disable.

Setting.documentation: Contains information about the configurable settings for a directory.

Type.documentation: The type, or category, of a directory setting. Similar settings have the same type. For example, Protocol, Cipher, or Certificate-Based Authentication.

Name.documentation:
The name of the directory setting. For example:

TLS_1_0

AllowedValues.documentation: The valid range of values for the directory setting. These values depend on the DataType of your directory.

AppliedValue.documentation: The value of the directory setting that is applied to the directory.

RequestedValue.documentation: The value that was last requested for the directory setting.

RequestStatus.documentation: The overall status of the request to update the directory setting request. If the directory setting is deployed in more than one region, and the request fails in any region, the overall status is Failed.

RequestDetailedStatus.documentation: Details about the status of the request to update the directory setting. If the directory setting is deployed in more than one region, status is returned for the request in each region where the setting is deployed.

RequestStatusMessage.documentation: The last status message for the directory status request.

LastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time when the directory setting was last updated.

LastRequestedDateTime.documentation: The date and time when the request to update a directory setting was last submitted.

DataType.documentation: The data type of a directory setting. This is used to define the AllowedValues of a setting. For example a data type can be Boolean, DurationInSeconds, or Enum.

SettingEntry.documentation: Contains information about the specified configurable setting for a directory.

DirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the Managed Microsoft AD directory that you want to share with other Amazon Web Services accounts.

ShareNotes.documentation: A directory share request that is sent by the directory owner to the directory consumer. The request includes a typed message to help the directory consumer administrator determine whether to approve or reject the share invitation.

ShareTarget.documentation: Identifier for the directory consumer account with whom the directory is to be shared.

ShareMethod.documentation: The method used when sharing a directory to determine whether the directory should be shared within your Amazon Web Services organization (ORGANIZATIONS) or with any Amazon Web Services account by sending a directory sharing request (HANDSHAKE).

SharedDirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the directory that is stored in the directory consumer account that is shared from the specified directory (DirectoryId).

ShareLimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum number of Amazon Web Services accounts that you can share with this directory has been reached.

Type.documentation: Type of identifier to be used in the Id field.

ShareTarget.documentation: Identifier that contains details about the directory consumer account.

OwnerAccountId.documentation: Identifier of the directory owner account, which contains the directory that has been shared to the consumer account.

OwnerDirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the directory in the directory owner account.

ShareMethod.documentation: The method used when sharing a directory to determine whether the directory should be shared within your Amazon Web Services organization (ORGANIZATIONS) or with any Amazon Web Services account by sending a shared directory request (HANDSHAKE).

SharedAccountId.documentation: Identifier of the directory consumer account that has access to the shared directory (OwnerDirectoryId) in the directory owner account.

SharedDirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the shared directory in the directory consumer account. This identifier is different for each directory owner account.

ShareStatus.documentation: Current directory status of the shared Managed Microsoft AD directory.

ShareNotes.documentation: A directory share request that is sent by the directory owner to the directory consumer. The request includes a typed message to help the directory consumer administrator determine whether to approve or reject the share invitation.

CreatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the shared directory was created.

LastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the shared directory was last updated.

SharedDirectory.documentation: Details about the shared directory in the directory owner account for which the share request in the directory consumer account has been accepted.

DirectoryId.documentation: The directory identifier.

StartTime.documentation: The date and time that the snapshot was taken.

SnapshotLimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum number of manual snapshots for the directory has been reached. You can use the GetSnapshotLimits operation to determine the snapshot limits for a directory.

ManualSnapshotsLimit.documentation: The maximum number of manual snapshots allowed.

ManualSnapshotsCurrentCount.documentation: The current number of manual snapshots of the directory.

ManualSnapshotsLimitReached.documentation: Indicates if the manual snapshot limit has been reached.

SnapshotLimits.documentation: Contains manual snapshot limit information for a directory.

Snapshots.documentation: A list of descriptions of directory snapshots.

AssessmentConfiguration.documentation: Configuration parameters for the directory assessment, including DNS server information, domain name, Amazon VPC subnet, and Amazon Web Services System Manager managed node details.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory for which to perform the assessment. This should be an existing directory. If the assessment is not for an existing directory, this parameter should be omitted.

AssessmentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the newly started directory assessment. Use this identifier to monitor assessment progress and retrieve results.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory for which the schema extension will be applied to.

CreateSnapshotBeforeSchemaExtension.documentation: If true, creates a snapshot of the directory before applying the schema extension.

LdifContent.documentation: The LDIF file represented as a string. To construct the LdifContent string, precede each line as it would be formatted in an ldif file with \n. See the example request below for more details. The file size can be no larger than 1MB.

SchemaExtensionId.documentation: The identifier of the schema extension that will be applied.

Key.documentation: Required name of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters and cannot be prefixed with "aws:". The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-', ':', '@'(Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

Value.documentation: The optional value of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-', ':', '@' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

Tag.documentation: Metadata assigned to a directory consisting of a key-value pair.

TagLimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum allowed number of tags was exceeded.

DirectoryId.documentation: The Directory ID of the Amazon Web Services directory involved in the trust relationship.

TrustId.documentation: The unique ID of the trust relationship.

RemoteDomainName.documentation: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the external domain involved in the trust relationship.

TrustType.documentation: The trust relationship type. Forest is the default.

CreatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the trust relationship was created.

LastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the trust relationship was last updated.

StateLastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the TrustState was last updated.

SelectiveAuth.documentation: Current state of selective authentication for the trust.

Trust.documentation: Describes a trust relationship between an Managed Microsoft AD directory and an external domain.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the Managed Microsoft AD directory that you want to stop sharing.

UnshareTarget.documentation: Identifier for the directory consumer account with whom the directory has to be unshared.

SharedDirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the directory stored in the directory consumer account that is to be unshared from the specified directory (DirectoryId).

Type.documentation: Type of identifier to be used in the Id field.

UnshareTarget.documentation: Identifier that contains details about the directory consumer account with whom the directory is being unshared.

UnsupportedSettingsException.documentation: The specified directory setting is not supported.

DirectoryId.documentation: The directory ID of the Amazon Web Services directory for which to update the conditional forwarder.

RemoteDomainName.documentation: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the remote domain with which you will set up a trust relationship.

DnsIpAddrs.documentation: The updated IP addresses of the remote DNS server associated with the conditional forwarder.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory on which you want to perform the update.

UpdateType.documentation: The type of update that needs to be performed on the directory. For example, OS.

OSUpdateSettings.documentation: The settings for the OS update that needs to be performed on the directory.

CreateSnapshotBeforeUpdate.documentation: The boolean that specifies if a snapshot for the directory needs to be taken before updating the directory.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the hybrid directory to update.

HybridAdministratorAccountUpdate.documentation:
We create a hybrid directory administrator account when we create a hybrid directory. Use HybridAdministratorAccountUpdate to recover the hybrid directory administrator account if you have deleted it.

To recover your hybrid directory administrator account, we need temporary access to a user in your self-managed AD with administrator permissions in the form of a secret from Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager. We use these credentials once during recovery and don't store them.

If your hybrid directory administrator account exists, then you dont need to use HybridAdministratorAccountUpdate, even if you have updated your self-managed AD administrator user.

SelfManagedInstancesSettings.documentation: Updates to the self-managed AD configuration, including DNS server IP addresses and Amazon Web Services System Manager managed node identifiers.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the updated hybrid directory.

AssessmentId.documentation: The identifier of the assessment performed to validate the update configuration. This assessment ensures the updated settings are compatible with your environment.

Status.documentation: The status of the update performed on the directory.

StatusReason.documentation: The reason for the current status of the update type activity.

InitiatedBy.documentation: This specifies if the update was initiated by the customer or by the service team.

NewValue.documentation: The new value of the target setting.

PreviousValue.documentation: The old value of the target setting.

StartTime.documentation: The start time of the UpdateDirectorySetup for the particular type.

LastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The last updated date and time of a particular directory setting.

UpdateInfoEntry.documentation: An entry of update information related to a requested update type.

DirectoryId.documentation: Identifier of the directory to which the domain controllers will be added or removed.

DesiredNumber.documentation: The number of domain controllers desired in the directory.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory for which to update the RADIUS server information.

RadiusSettings.documentation: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server.

DirectoryId.documentation: The identifier of the directory for which to update settings.
The identifier of the directory.

UpdateValue.documentation: The value for a given type of UpdateSettings.

UserDoesNotExistException.documentation: The user provided a username that does not exist in your directory.

TrustId.documentation: The unique Trust ID of the trust relationship to verify.

VerifyTrustRequest.documentation: Initiates the verification of an existing trust relationship between an Managed Microsoft AD directory and an external domain.

TrustId.documentation: The unique Trust ID of the trust relationship that was verified.

documentation:
Directory Service

Directory Service is a web service that makes it easy for you to setup and run directories in the Amazon Web Services cloud, or connect your Amazon Web Services resources with an existing self-managed Microsoft Active Directory. This guide provides detailed information about Directory Service operations, data types, parameters, and errors. For information about Directory Services features, see Directory Service and the Directory Service Administration Guide.

Amazon Web Services provides SDKs that consist of libraries and sample code for various programming languages and platforms (Java, Ruby, .Net, iOS, Android, etc.). The SDKs provide a convenient way to create programmatic access to Directory Service and other Amazon Web Services services. For more information about the Amazon Web Services SDKs, including how to download and install them, see Tools for Amazon Web Services.
